intro: Villamilla racemosa, commonly known as the clustered raceme plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and features palmate leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters along the stems. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm climates.
